questions.question: Listen to the audio and choose the best description.
options: They're clapping their hands.
They're facing one another.
They're waving their hands.
They're pacing around the place.
questions.script:
（A）They're clapping their hands.
（B）They're facing one another.
（C）They're waving their hands.
（D）They're pacing around the place.
（A）他们正在鼓掌。
（B）他们正面对着面。
（C）他们正在挥手。
（D）他们正在附近慢慢地走着。
·They are shaking hands.
他们正在握手。
·The men are looking at each other.
312

两个人在相互看着对方。
·They are greeting one another.
他们在相互问候。

questions.question: Listen to the audio and choose the best description.
options: A piece of furniture is being repaired.
A machine is being worked on.
A toolbox is being opened.
A desk drawer is being closed.
questions.script:
（A）A piece of furniture is being repaired.
（B）A machine is being worked on.
（C）A toolbox is being opened.
（D）A desk drawer is being closed.
（A）一件家具正在被修理。
（B）一台机器正在被修理。
（C）一个工具箱正在被打开。
（D）一个书桌抽屉正在被关上。
·The machine has been taken
apart.
机器已经被拆开了。
·The machine is being fixed.
机器正在被修理。
·The machine is being put together.
机器正在被组装。

questions.question: Listen to the audio and choose the best description.
options: She has finished talking on the phone.
A notice is being posted on the door.
She has the receiver held up to her ear.
A coin is being placed into the slot.
questions.script:
（A）She has finished talking on the phone.
（B）A notice is being posted on the door.
（C）She has the receiver held up to her ear.
（D）A coin is being placed into the slot.
（A）她已经打完电话了。
（B）一张通知正被人往门上贴。
（C）她把听筒举到耳朵边。
（D）一枚硬币正被放进投币口。
·She's speaking into a phone.
她正在打电话。
·She's involved in a phone conversation.
她正在通话当中。
·A public phone is in use.
一部公用电话正在被使用。
313

questions.question: Listen to the audio and choose the best description.
options: Some people are sunbathing near the lake.
Some people are ready to go for a swim.
Some people are strolling near the water.
Some people have put their feet in the water.
questions.script:
（A）Some people are sunbathing near the lake.
（B）Some people are ready to go for a swim.
（C）Some people are strolling near the water.
（D）Some people have put their feet in the water.
（A）一些人正在湖边沐日光浴。
（B）一些人准备好了去游泳。
（C）一些人正在水边闲逛。
（D）一些人已经把脚放入了水中。
·Some men are walking along the water.
几个人正在水边散步。
·The people are walking toward a bridge.
人们正朝一座桥走去。
·There are no swimmers in the water.
水中没有人在游泳。

questions.question: Listen to the audio and choose the best description.
options: He's serving food to the others.
He's holding a plastic cup in his hand.
He's arranging the plates on the table.
He's helping himself to some food.
questions.script:
（A）He's serving food to the others.
（B）He's holding a plastic cup in his hand.
（C）He's arranging the plates on the table.
（D）He's helping himself to some food.
（A）他正在为别人上菜。
（B）他的手中正拿着一个塑料杯。
（C）他正往桌上摆放盘子。
（D）他正在随便吃些东西。
·A man is putting food onto his plate. 男士正在把食物放到自己的盘子里。
·A variety of food has been laid out on the table.
各种食物已经被摆在桌子上了。
·Some food has been prepared on the table. 一些食物已经准备好了，放在
桌子上。

questions.question: Listen to the audio and choose the best description.
options: The house is undergoing renovations.
The bushes are being trimmed.
Some furniture has been set out in the yard.
People are relaxing in the backyard.
questions.script:
（A）The house is undergoing renovations.
（B）The bushes are being trimmed.
（C）Some furniture has been set out in the yard.
（D）People are relaxing in the backyard.
（A）房子正在被整修。
314

（B）小树丛正在被修剪。
（C）一些家具已经被放到院子里了。
（D）人们正在后院里放松。
·A portion of the area has been shaded.
一部分地方被树荫遮住了。
·The seats have been positioned in the shaded area.
座椅已经被放在了阴凉处。
·The grass has been neatly trimmed.
草坪已经被整齐地修剪过了。
注：在Part 1中，每道试题都添加了3种可能的正确表达方式，考生可
以了解对于同样的照片可能出现的不同表达。

questions.question: Who will draft the letter?
options: He will come by later.
Yes, he left it there.
Jane is working on it now. 谁将会起草这封信？
questions.script:
Who will draft the letter?
（A）He will come by later.
（B）Yes, he left it there.
（C）Jane is working on it now.
谁将会起草这封信？
（A）他会晚一点来。
（B）是的，他把它留在那儿了。
（C）简正在写。
Q Who is going to write the letter?
A Jane will.
谁将会写这封信？
—简。

questions.question: When are they going to release the report?
options: By fax.
At two o'clock.
In Room 15. 他们什么时候发布这个报告？
questions.script:
When are they going to release the report?
（A）By fax.
（B）At two o'clock.
（C）In Room 15.
他们什么时候发布这个报告？
（A）用传真。
（B）在2点。
（C）在15号房间。
Q When will they announce the result of the report?
315

A Before the end of the day.
他们什么时候会宣布报告结果？
—今天下班之前。

questions.question: Do you know where I can catch a bus to downtown?
options: He just left a minute ago.
Sure, I will catch you later.
Try the stop over there. 你知道在哪儿能坐公交车去市中心吗？
questions.script:
Do you know where I can catch a bus to downtown?
（A）He just left a minute ago.
（B）Sure, I will catch you later.
（C）Try the stop over there.
你知道在哪儿能坐公交车去市中心吗？
（A）他一分钟前刚走。
（B）当然，我晚点儿再跟你谈。
（C）去那边的车站看看。
Q Where is the bus stop for the bus to downtown?
A Across the street.
到市中心的公交车站在哪儿？
—街对面。

questions.question: Were you able to pick up the books you need?
options: I booked it this morning.
No, they were all sold out.
Can you pick me up at 5? 你买到需要的书了吗？
questions.script:
Were you able to pick up the books you need?
（A）I booked it this morning.
（B）No, they were all sold out.
（C）Can you pick me up at 5?
你买到需要的书了吗？
（A）我今天上午预订了。
（B）没有，都卖完了。
（C）你能5点来接我吗？
Q Did you manage to find the books you were looking for?
A No, they didn't have them in stock.
你找到你一直在找的书了吗？
—没有，这些书他们没货了。

questions.question: How long will you be on the road today?
options: I'll be back around three.
Roughly an hour ago.
Yes, I will be driving there. 你今天在路上会花多长时间？
questions.script:
How long will you be on the road today?
（A）I'll be back around three.
（B）Roughly an hour ago.
（C）Yes, I will be driving there.
你今天在路上会花多长时间？
316

（A）我会在三点左右回来。
（B）大约一个小时之前。
（C）是的，我会开车去那儿。
Q How long will you be gone for today?
A I should be back by noon.
你今天要离开多久？
—我应该中午之前回来。
注：在Part 2中，为帮助考生提高听懂题目的能力，添加了和试题相同
或相似的表达方法。

questions.question: Did you get in touch with him, or should I try calling?
options: I just got off the phone with him.
He is sitting on the couch.
I'll get it for you later. 你和他联系上了没有，要我打电话试试看吗？
questions.script:
Did you get in touch with him, or should I try calling?
（A）I just got off the phone with him.
（B）He is sitting on the couch.
（C）I'll get it for you later.
你和他联系上了没有，要我打电话试试看吗？
（A）我刚和他讲完电话。
（B）他正在长椅上坐着。
（C）我过一会儿把它带给你。
Q Were you able to get through to him, or do you want me to try calling him?
A Could you try calling him again?
你能打通他的电话吗，还是你想让我试着给他打电话？
—你能给他再打一遍试试吗？

questions.question: Don't you have to go to your appointment with your lawyer soon?
options: To discuss some legal matters.
Yes, right after I am done with this.
No, he made a point not to do that. 你不是马上就得去见你的律师吗？
questions.script:
Don't you have to go to your appointment with your lawyer soon?
（A）To discuss some legal matters.
（B）Yes, right after I am done with this.
（C）No, he made a point not to do that.
你不是马上就得去见你的律师吗？
（A）去讨论一些法律事宜。
（B）是的，我做完这个马上就去。
（C）不，他强调不能那样做。
Q Shouldn't you be leaving for your appointment with your lawyer now?
A No, I am seeing him later today.
你不是应该出发去见你的律师了吗？
317

—不，我今天晚些时候见他。

questions.question: Who's planning to take you to the software exhibition?
options: He will take his car.
Jack said he will.
To get some information. 谁计划带你去软件展览？
questions.script:
Who's planning to take you to the software exhibition?
（A）He will take his car.
（B）Jack said he will.
（C）To get some information.
谁计划带你去软件展览？
（A）他会用他的车。
（B）杰克说他会。
（C）去获得一些信息。
Q Who is going to drive you to the software exhibition?
A I'm supposed to go with Mr. Smith later.
谁将开车带你去软件展览？
—我稍后应该会和史密斯先生一起去。

questions.question: Why is Suki leaving the company?
options: She decided to go back to school.
Sure, just leave it right here.
Yes, she doesn't get along with her boss. 苏琪为什么离开公司？
questions.script:
Why is Suki leaving the company?
（A）She decided to go back to school.
（B）Sure, just leave it right here.
（C）Yes, she doesn't get along with her boss.
苏琪为什么离开公司？
（A）她决定重返校园。
（B）当然，就把它放在这儿吧。
（C）是的，她和老板相处得不好。
Q Why is Suki quitting the firm?
A She wants to study more.
苏琪为什么放弃公司的工作？
—她想学习更多的知识。

questions.question: David Wells did a good job delivering his speech today, didn't he?
options: He took it to a wrong address.
No, the job is quite interesting.
Yes, he did a great job. 戴维·韦尔斯今天的演讲做得很好，是吧？
questions.script:
David Wells did a good job delivering his speech today, didn't he?
（A）He took it to a wrong address.
（B）No, the job is quite interesting.
（C）Yes, he did a great job.
戴维·韦尔斯今天的演讲做得很好，是吧？
（A）他把它送到了错误的地址。
（B）不，这个工作很有趣。
318

（C）是的，他表现得非常好。
Q David Wells gave a great speech today, didn't he?
A Yes, it was one of his best speeches ever.
戴维·韦尔斯今天做了一个很棒的演讲，是吧？
—是的，这次是他最好的演讲之一。

questions.question: Don't you feel a bit chilly with the air conditioner on?
options: Yes, it's freezing in here.
No, I don't feel too well.
He is a bit silly. 你不觉得开着空调有点儿冷吗？
questions.script:
Don't you feel a bit chilly with the air conditioner on?
（A）Yes, it's freezing in here.
（B）No, I don't feel too well.
（C）He is a bit silly.
你不觉得开着空调有点儿冷吗？
（A）是的，这里非常冷。
（B）不，我感觉不太好。
（C）他有点儿蠢。
Q Isn't it a bit cold with the air conditioner on?
A It is a bit chilly, isn't it?
空调开着不冷吗？
—有点儿冷，是吧？

questions.question: Where do you suppose I could pick up the items on the list?
options: Try looking in the store over there.
It's too heavy to pick it up alone.
Yes, I think you can do it. 你认为我在哪儿能买到清单上的东西？
questions.script:
Where do you suppose I could pick up the items on the list?
（A）Try looking in the store over there.
（B）It's too heavy to pick it up alone.
（C）Yes, I think you can do it.
你认为我在哪儿能买到清单上的东西？
（A）去那边的商店试试看。
（B）它太沉了，我一个人拿不起来。
（C）是的，我认为你能行。
Q Where do you think I can buy the things on the list?
A Probably in that supermarket over there.
你认为我在哪儿能买到清单上的东西？
—在那边的超市可能会买到。

questions.question: Are you planning to attend the meeting this afternoon?
options: Yes, I need to do it now.
Is Tuesday okay with you? 319
Yes, but only for a while. 你计划参加今天下午的会议吗？
questions.script:
Are you planning to attend the meeting this afternoon?
（A）Yes, I need to do it now.
（B）Is Tuesday okay with you?
319

（C）Yes, but only for a while.
你计划参加今天下午的会议吗？
（A）是的，我需要现在做。
（B）星期二你可以吗？
（C）是的，但是只能参加一会儿。
Q Will you be going to this afternoon's meeting?
A Yes, but I have to leave early.
你会参加今天下午的会议吗？
—是的，但是我得早些离开。

questions.question: Mr. Suzuki is waiting for the delivery, isn't he?
options: He will be here shortly.
No, I don't know him well.
Yes, he's downstairs at the lobby now. 铃木先生在等邮件送来，是吗？
questions.script:
Mr. Suzuki is waiting for the delivery, isn't he?
（A）He will be here shortly.
（B）No, I don't know him well.
（C）Yes, he's downstairs at the lobby now.
铃木先生在等邮件送来，是吗？
（A）他很快就到这儿了。
（B）不，我不太了解他。
（C）是的，他现在在楼下的休息室。
Q Mr. Suzuki is expecting a package to be delivered, isn't he?
A Yes, he asked me to call him when it arrives.
铃木先生在等一个邮递包裹，是吗？
—是的，他让我在包裹送到的时候给他打电话。

questions.question: Would you be interested in joining our entertainment committee?
options: He is a very interesting person.
Yes, but I don't have time these days.
When I was at the movies. 你有兴趣加入我们的娱乐委员会吗？
questions.script:
Would you be interested in joining our entertainment committee?
（A）He is a very interesting person.
（B）Yes, but I don't have time these days.
（C）When I was at the movies.
你有兴趣加入我们的娱乐委员会吗？
（A）他是个很有趣的人。
（B）是的，不过我最近没有时间。
（C）当我在电影院的时候。
Q How would you like to join our entertainment committee?
A I would love to but I can't spare the time nowadays.
你愿意参加我们的娱乐委员会吗？
320

—我很愿意，但是现在我抽不出时间来。

questions.question: Isn't there an additional charge to send it by express mail?
options: No, everything is included in the cost.
I will charge it on my credit card.
Yes, there will be a couple more people. 用特快专递邮寄没有额外收费吗？
questions.script:
Isn't there an additional charge to send it by express mail?
（A）No, everything is included in the cost.
（B）I will charge it on my credit card.
（C）Yes, there will be a couple more people.
用特快专递邮寄没有额外收费吗？
（A）没有，所有费用都已经包括在内。
（B）我要用信用卡付费。
（C）是的，还会再来几个人。
Q Isn't it more expensive to use express mail service?
A No, there is no difference in the price.
用特快专递服务不是更贵吗？
—不，价格没有区别。

questions.question: Should I sign my name on the first page or all the pages?
options: I already told you his name.
Just sign the last one.
The sign is rather noticeable. 我应当在第一页签名，还是每一页都签？
questions.script:
Should I sign my name on the first page or all the pages?
（A）I already told you his name.
（B）Just sign the last one.
（C）The sign is rather noticeable.
我应当在第一页签名，还是每一页都签？
（A）我已经告诉你他的名字了。
（B）只需在最后一页签。
（C）标记很明显。
Q Where do you want me to sign, on the first page, or the last page?
A Please sign on the last page.
你想让我在哪儿签字，第一页还是最后一页？
—请在最后一页签字。

questions.question: Did the contractor give you the completion date?
options: I will finish it by then.
He said sometime in May.
He will make the suggestion. 承包人告诉你完成日期了吗？
questions.script:
Did the contractor give you the completion date?
（A）I will finish it by then.
（B）He said sometime in May.
（C）He will make the suggestion.
承包人告诉你完成日期了吗？
（A）我到时候就会完成。
（B）他说五月份的某个时候。
321

（C）他会提出建议。
Q Did the contractor let you know when the completion date will be?
A I received his phone call this morning.
承包人告诉你完成日期是什么时候了吗？
—我今天上午接到他的电话了。

questions.question: Don't you think this design could be improved more?
options: To the designated area.
Why? Don't you think it looks nice?
Yes, we decided to proofread it again. 你不认为这个设计还可以再改进吗？
questions.script:
Don't you think this design could be improved more?
（A）To the designated area.
（B）Why? Don't you think it looks nice?
（C）Yes, we decided to proofread it again.
你不认为这个设计还可以再改进吗？
（A）去指定的区域。
（B）为什么？你不认为它看起来很漂亮吗？
（C）是的，我们决定再校对一遍。
Q Don't you think we need to work on this design a bit more?
A Yes, I was thinking the same thing.
你不觉得我们需要把这个设计再加工一下吗？
—是的，我正是这么想的。

questions.question: Would you rather meet over lunch or after two today?
options: That sounds fine by me.
I have to meet a client at noon.
How is the Italian place? 你愿意今天午饭时见面还是两点以后？
questions.script:
Would you rather meet over lunch or after two today?
（A）That sounds fine by me.
（B）I have to meet a client at noon.
（C）How is the Italian place?
你愿意今天午饭时见面还是两点以后？
（A）我觉得那听起来不错。
（B）我中午得见一个客户。
（C）意大利风味的地方怎么样？
Q Do you want to get together for lunch or after lunch?
A I'm meeting someone for lunch today.
你想中午见面一起吃饭还是午饭后见面？
—我今天要和一个人共进午餐。

questions.question: Can you give me a hand moving the couch, please?
options: To the second floor.
That is a great offer. 322
Sure, give me a second first. 你能帮我挪一下这个长椅吗？
questions.script:
Can you give me a hand moving the couch, please?
（A）To the second floor.
（B）That is a great offer.
322

（C）Sure, give me a second first.
你能帮我挪一下这个长椅吗？
（A）到二层去。
（B）那是一个很好的提议。
（C）当然可以，稍等我一会儿。
Q Would it be possible for you to help me move the sofa?
A Sure, I'll be with you in a second.
你能帮我挪一下这个沙发吗？
—当然可以，我一会儿就来帮你。

questions.question:
Why don't you see if you can get a transfer to a branch office closer to your
place?
options: I live about twenty minutes from here.
Yes, I was planning on doing that.
Two of my friends live there. 你为什么不考虑看看能否调到离家近一些的分公司呢？
questions.script:
Why don't you see if you can get a transfer to a branch office closer to your
place?
（A）I live about twenty minutes from here.
（B）Yes, I was planning on doing that.
（C）Two of my friends live there.
你为什么不考虑看看能否调到离家近一些的分公司呢？
（A）我住在离这儿二十分钟远的地方。
（B）是的，我正打算那样做。
（C）我的两个朋友住在那儿。
Q Why don't you put in a transfer request to work at the branch near your
place?
A I submitted the form yesterday.
你为什么不提交一个调动申请，到离你家近些的分公司工作呢？
—我昨天提交了申请表。

questions.question: Has anyone heard where the director went this morning?
options: Mr. Sellers is coming this morning.
I've been hearing it a lot lately, too.
No, but Judy should know where he is. 有人知道主管今天上午去哪儿了吗？
questions.script:
Has anyone heard where the director went this morning?
（A）Mr. Sellers is coming this morning.
（B）I've been hearing it a lot lately, too.
（C）No, but Judy should know where he is.
有人知道主管今天上午去哪儿了吗？
（A）塞勒斯先生今天上午要来。
（B）关于这件事，我最近也听说了很多。
（C）不知道，但是朱迪应该知道他在哪儿。
Q Does anybody know where the director is this morning?
323

A He went to see a client.
有人知道主管今天上午在哪儿吗？
—他去见客户了。

questions.question: What is your opinion regarding Johnson's project?
options: It is going to be very profitable.
Yes, John will be here today.
Sure, I will put you in charge of it. 你对约翰逊的项目怎么看？
questions.script:
What is your opinion regarding Johnson's project?
（A）It is going to be very profitable.
（B）Yes, John will be here today.
（C）Sure, I will put you in charge of it.
你对约翰逊的项目怎么看？

Questions 56 through 58 refer to the following conversation.
M: Hey, congratulations. I just heard from Mr. Shaw that the directors
have come to a decision regarding the proposal you gave at this morning's
meeting.（56）
W: Yes, I just heard the news myself, and you wouldn't believe how relieved I
am. I mean, considering the number of days and nights the guys on our team worked
to prepare for this morning's presentation, I had to get the approval. I was so afraid
that I would not be able to convince the directors. But, I guess I did all right.
M: Are you kidding? It was perfect. I thought it was one of the best
speeches you have ever given.（57）In fact, I wasn't too sure about the
possibility of the project myself until I heard your speech. You really did a good
339

job.
W: Thanks. I owe it all to my staff.（58）This calls for a celebration.
M: 嘿，祝贺你。我刚听肖先生说董事们对你今天上午在会议上提出的
建议做出决定了。
W: 是的，我自己也是刚听说这个消息。你肯定不会相信我有多欣慰。
我的意思是，考虑到我们的团队为了准备今天上午的报告而努力工作的日日
夜夜，建议就必须获得通过。我特别担心说服不了董事们。不过，我想我表
现得不错。
M: 你开玩笑吧？表现得很完美。我认为这是你做过的最好的发言了。
实际上，我自己最初不太肯定这个项目能否做下去，直到我听了你的发言才
相信。你做得真的很不错。
W: 谢谢你。这一切都要归功于我的同事。要庆祝一下才行。

Questions 83 through 85 refer to the following broadcast.
I'm Jack Thompson, presenting another edition of “Tips for Your Trip”.
Christmas time is here again, so it's important for all of you making that long
drive home to be extra careful on the road.（83）So listen carefully. Firstly,
there will be many tired and stressed drivers on the road, so you will need to be
extra careful. Secondly, try to share the driving with a friend or relative or two
if possible.（84）That way there will always be someone who can take over the
steering wheel when you're tired.Thirdly, take a break when you start to notice
the effects of drowsiness—drifting, blurry vision, and yawning.（84）And
finally, remember that drinking a lot of coffee can only help you fight drowsiness
for a short time. Learn to recognize the signs of sleepiness, and stop.（84）
Have a good sleep. Don't drive after midnight if you can possibly avoid it.（84）
That's all, but please listen again next week for more“Tips for Your Trip”.
（85）
我是杰克·汤普森，为您带来新一期的“旅途小贴士”节目。圣诞节又到
了，对每个人都很重要的就是确保在开车回家的漫长旅程中格外小心。所
以，请您认真收听。首先，道路上将会有很多疲惫、紧张的司机，所以你需
要多加小心。第二，如果可能的话，尽量和一两个亲友共同开车。这样在你
疲劳的时候总能有人接过你手中的方向盘。第三，在你开始感觉到睡意的时
357

候，比如摇晃、视线模糊、打哈欠，马上休息一下。最后，记住大量喝咖啡
只能帮你在短时间内抵御睡意。要学会识别瞌睡的信号，然后停车。睡个好
觉。如果可能的话，就不要后半夜开车。今天的节目就到这儿，请您下周继
续收听“旅途小贴士”。

Questions 86 through 88 refer to the following talk.
Welcome all of you. And thank you for making the effort to come so promptly.
As all of you know, we have to move out of this building by the end of the
month（86, 87）because the owner is asking too much money for rent. And you
also know how difficult it is to rent a place in this city at an affordable price. The
head chef and I have spent a lot of time trying to find premises that are both in the
right location and have the character we need to maintain the tradition of our
restaurant.（88）Well, you'll be happy to hear that we've found the ideal
location.（86）After weeks of fruitless searching, we heard of a first floor site
which was originally a French restaurant near the local theater. We contacted the
agents immediately and inspected the site. It's great, and we've signed a 3-
year contract.（86）So let's get busy; we have a lot of work to do! Thanks again
for your commitment.
欢迎大家。感谢大家设法如此迅速地赶来。正如大家所知，我们必须在
月底之前搬出这栋大楼，因为房东索要的房租太贵了。大家也知道在这个城
市很难租到价格合适的房子。我和主厨花了很多时间寻找位置合适又具备我
们需要的能够保留我们饭店传统特色的店面。哦，你们听到这个消息会很高
兴，我们找到了理想的地方。几周毫无收获的寻找之后，我们听说本地剧院
附近的一处店面，在一楼，那里原来是一家法国餐馆。我们马上联系房产经
纪人并去看了店面。那里很棒，我们签下了三年的合同。所以我们得忙起来
了，有很多工作要做！再次感谢大家的支持。
effort 努力 promptly 敏捷地，迅速地 affordable price 负担得起的价格
premises 房产，房屋 character 特征，个性 maintain 保持，维持 tradition 传统
fruitless 没有结果的 agent 经纪人，代理人 commitment 支持 alert 使注意
gather 收集，聚集 renegotiate 重新谈判，再协商

Questions 89 through 91 refer to the following speech.
Hello, everybody. I'm Wendy Raynford, and I'd like to welcome you to our
company's orientation program.（89）Firstly, let me tell you about the schedule
for this week's training. One of our personnel officers, Tim O'Brien,（90）will
hand out envelopes containing some forms for you as well as company information.
We'll look over the forms together, and then you can fill them out. This will be
followed by a tea break and a chance to talk informally with members of the
personnel staff. At 11:00 a.m. we will break into 3 groups for a tour of the
production facilities,（91）with our volunteer guides who are keen to meet you.
This will be followed by lunch at 12:30. You will then have free time to visit the
grounds before the start of the afternoon program at 1:30 p.m. This will begin with
a company promotional and training video, lasting 1 hour.
大家好，我是温迪·雷恩福德，欢迎大家参加我们公司的“新员工培训计
划”。首先，让我来告诉大家本周培训的日程安排。我们的人事专员之一，
蒂姆·奥布赖恩，会发给大家装有表格和公司信息的信封。我们将一起浏览
这些表格，然后你们要把表格填好。之后是茶点和休息时间，在此期间大家
将有机会和人事部的同事进行非正式的交谈。到了11点，我们会分成三组，
由志愿导游陪同大家参观生产设施。我们的导游非常想见到大家。12点半是
午餐时间。午餐后到下午1点半培训之前是自由活动时间，大家可以参观厂
区。培训开始时会播放一段时长为1小时的公司宣传及培训录像。
orientation （任职等前的）培训 personnel 人事部门；员工 hand out 下
发，分发 look over 查看，看一遍 fill out 填写 tea break 享用茶点的休息时间
volunteer 志愿者 ground 空地，庭院 promotional 推广的，促销的 last 持续
bunch 束，串，群

Questions 92 through 94 refer to the following talk.
Good morning. As I'm sure you're aware, the gallery's management committee
362

has requested an engineering survey of the site and its facilities. The aim of this
survey is twofold: first, to find remedies for certain serious problems which
have resulted in damage to the building（92）and parts of the collection;
secondly, to consider how the facilities can be improved. I have to report to you
that the structure of the building requires immediate attention. Neglect has
resulted in serious damage.（93）I know that the necessary renovations will be
expensive and funding is a problem. But my consultants are certain that, if we
act now, far more serious and expensive repairs can be avoided.（94）
上午好。我相信大家一定知道，美术馆的管理委员会要求针对馆址及其
设施进行一次工程勘察。勘察的目的有两方面：一、找到损坏建筑物和部分
藏品的严重问题的补救措施；二、考虑如何改善设施。我必须告诉大家，我
们需要立即关注这座建筑物的结构。疏忽已经造成了严重的损坏。我知道必
要的修缮会很贵，资金是个问题。但是我的顾问们确信，如果我们现在就行
动，能免去更多重大而昂贵的维修。
be aware 知道，意识到 engineering 工程的 survey 调查，勘察 facility 设
施 twofold 两方面的 remedy 补救（法）；纠正（法）damage 破坏，损坏
collection 收集品，收藏 structure 结构；建筑物 immediate attention 立即关注
neglect 疏忽，玩忽 funding 资金 beyond 超过 due 到期的 suitable 合适的
auction 拍卖会 recruit 招募
